title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 303.4 - Fishing, diving and loitering
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 303.4 - Fishing, diving and loitering

State Regulations

No person shall fish or dive from the bridge or loiter on
property over which the authority exercises jurisdiction. (a) Prohibition on diving from the Atlantic

Beach Bridge. (1)

Definitions. Whenever used
in this Chapter, unless a different meaning clearly appears from the context, the terms herein shall be defined as follows: (i) Diving includes diving or jumping off of
the Atlantic Beach Bridge in any manner. It shall be unlawful for any person to
dive or jump off of any portion of the Atlantic Beach Bridge. (b) Violations and
penalties. Violations of this section by any person shall be a civil offense
punishable by a fine of not less than $500 nor more than $1,000 for each
offense. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

303.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
